title: 104_s1970
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Museum of the American Indian Act Amendments of 1996". References in the Act are considered to be made to the National Museum of the American Indian Act. Section 5(f)(1)(B) is amended by replacing "an Assistant Secretary" with "a senior official". Section 11(a) of the National Museum of the American Indian Act is amended to include a deadline for the completion of an inventory by the Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution. The inventory is defined as a simple list identifying the geographic and cultural affiliation of remains and objects. Additionally, Section 11(f) is amended to authorize appropriations for both this section and section 11A. The National Museum of the American Indian Act is amended to include a new section for the summary and repatriation of unassociated funerary objects, sacred objects, and cultural patrimony. The Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution is required to provide a written summary by December 31, 1996, based on available information held by the Smithsonian. The National Museum of the American Indian Act requires the Smithsonian Institution to provide a summary including information from the Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act. If cultural affiliation is established, the Smithsonian must return unassociated funerary objects, sacred objects, or objects of cultural patrimony to requesting tribes or organizations. The National Museum of the American Indian Act mandates the return of unassociated funerary objects or sacred objects to direct lineal descendants or tribes who can prove ownership or control. If no lineal descendants claim the object, it must be returned to the tribe or organization. The National Museum of the American Indian Act requires the return of Native American cultural items upon request by tribes or Native Hawaiian organizations. The Smithsonian Institution must return the objects unless it can prove rightful possession. Museums repatriating items in good faith are protected from liability under the Act. The National Museum of the American Indian Act mandates the return of Native American cultural items upon request by tribes or Native Hawaiian organizations. The Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution is allowed to exceed the Act's requirements in inventorying, summarizing, and repatriating unassociated funerary objects, sacred objects, or objects of cultural patrimony. The term 'Native Hawaiian organization' is defined as per the Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act. SEC. 5. SPECIAL COMMITTEE. Amends Section 12 to increase the number of members on the committee to 7, with at least 2 members being traditional Indian religious leaders. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
